lines.text: My hat... where's my hat?
Take it easy, mister, here it is. You got a .45 slug in you and you're worried about your hat. Must be some hat.
It is.
You Are Now Entering The Town of Tumult At Your Own Risk
We better get you to a doctor. Know one?
I need a drink first before the doctor.
Looks to me like you need both.
Stand aside! Give him air!
Save it, Doc. He's dead.
Yeah? You run your department and I'll run mine.
I got a room; put your cross down. Two bucks without a window, three bucks with - in advance.
How much extra for a *bed*?
If you don't like Our Rooms Where Else can You Go
Do you always come breaking into your room with a six-gun in your hand?
Only when I'm expecting company.
You knew I'd be here?
Had an idea somebody'd be here when the clerk switched keys on me. I'm glad it turned out to be you.
[Janet whips out her pistol as Ed holsters his gun]
Maybe you won't be.
What's your name?
Ed Garry. What's yours?
Claire Benton.
Joel Benton's sister?
So you've met him already.
I've met him.
He's a big man around here. Just ask him anytime - He'll tell you.
Hey, Claire! I thought the dining room was closed.
Well, Ed had to eat.
Ed? Say, you get chummy pretty fast, don't you, Sis?
Why don't you stick to running the town.
[Dan is measuring Eli for a coffin]
Uh-oh. Uh-oh. Never mind, Dan - he's still breathin'. Too bad.
Don't worry about it, Doc. You'll get him sometime anyway.
[Jim knocks out Joel's henchman after a long fistfight]
So the big man gets wronged.
I thought I told you to get out!
Sure... sure you did. Only you're not such a big man anymore. You're stock's going down.
Say, you know the town could use a man like you.
You or the town?
Same thing.
On your way, Redwood. You, too, Benton
What? Am I under arrest?
No, but I feel safer with you in front of me.

[from his jail cell]
When I get out of here, you're the first one I'm going to look up.
Don't crowd your luck - it's been all bad so far.
[Ed and Claire are about to kiss]
I hate to interrupt, but you happen to be on my property.
Sorry, Janet. I didn't see your brand on him.

[to his horse]
Let that be a lesson to you - never kiss a girl on another girl's ranch.
You string along with me and I'll make you more money than you've ever dreamed of.
You, ah, you mean you want me to get rid of Benton?
Now you're getting smart.
And if I do get rid of Benton... what's the split?
And if I don't?
Then you're not so smart.
It's a deal.
Good. We'll get along.
So long as that you don't figure by getting rid of Benton you've only got me to handle.
Hadn't thought of that.
[Masters leaves]
...I had.
[last lines]
By virtue of the authority vested in me by the state of Wyoming, I say, "On with the weddin'."
[speaking directly to the audience]
Ya see what I told ya? I get 'em one way or t'other.
